body:
Having taken all your feedback on board, we've made some fundamental changes to the way categories work. Yesterday, we stopped the disparate treatment of some categories, and made all categories on by default.

To address the concerns of front page appearance, we've put a category selection splash page up for people visiting the Ruqqus home page for the first time. This allows people to pick what they are interested in before having to look at anything.

It looks like this on desktop:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190732810387496/unknown.png)

And like this on mobile:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190986573512704/unknown.png)

This page is also accessible on mobile via the top right dropdown, allowing mobile users to edit their category selections. Yes, this includes selecting the "uncategorized" category.

Thank you everyone for your feedback and the vigorous debate over the best way to preserve freedom.

body:
So how does this work exactly? Are the not-selected categories hidden, or does it just prioritize those categories over others?

The former sounds like making all categories opt-in. Which is... *okay*... it isn't treating categories differently or anything. But having the categories on by default and then letting users opt out of them seems more intuitive. That way they can make a more informed decision.

Wouldn't it be better to instead of asking about "what categories do you want to see" to ask "what categories do you wish to hide"?

I might be just missunderstanding how this will work. Any clarification would be appreciated.

body:
Suggestions:

1. Add the "uncategorized" section to the splash page (maybe rename it to "Other / Miscellaneous"). (I'm not talking about /categories. I'm talking about the splash page.) Otherwise, the visibility of uncategorized guilds is still going to be hindered.
2. Put a "Skip and show all" button right next to the "Welcome to Ruqqus" / "Select Categories" text for convenience. I know there's already a "show all" button at the bottom of the page, but I dislike it when there's no easy-to-find skip button on these types of pages.
3. Can this only apply to the "home" page and not the "all" page for logged out users? I'm obsessed with archiving the front page of ruqqus on sites like archive.org and archive.is, and I'm not sure if it can still be done. (If the user hasn't chosen any categories yet, then display all categories on the /all page.)
4. It looks like when you first sign up, you get redirected to the /browse page. I think that it was mentioned that you didn't want new users seeing the site prompt them to join guilds like +HitlerWasRight (which conveniently happens to be trending). I think they should be redirected to the front page instead.

<sup> - sfrohne [ If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username | [RIP Klenny](https://ruqq.us/2g1v) | Comment id lt9z ]</sup>

post.body:
Having taken all your feedback on board, we've made some fundamental changes to the way categories work. Yesterday, we stopped the disparate treatment of some categories, and made all categories on by default.

To address the concerns of front page appearance, we've put a category selection splash page up for people visiting the Ruqqus home page for the first time. This allows people to pick what they are interested in before having to look at anything.

It looks like this on desktop:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190732810387496/unknown.png)

And like this on mobile:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190986573512704/unknown.png)

This page is also accessible on mobile via the top right dropdown, allowing mobile users to edit their category selections. Yes, this includes selecting the "uncategorized" category.

Thank you everyone for your feedback and the vigorous debate over the best way to preserve freedom.

body:
Actually, my main concern was about the offensive category. "Do you wish to turn off our offensive filter" seems like pressuring the user, while "Do you wish to turn it on" just seems like an option that no one has to take. Pressuring the user to filter out a category which is vague almost by definition would be... questionable.

But I can't see the offensive category in the selection at all. Does this mean that it has been removed? If so, then I have no issue with this. I trust the admins to apply categories like "politics" or "culture" fairly, since there is no negative connotation, and the users to know exactly what they mean.

I'd still appreciate clarification whether it will hide them completely or merely give them a lower priority or something though.

I trust the admins to apply categories like "politics" or "culture" fairly, since there is no negative connotation, and the users to know exactly what they mean.

I'd still appreciate clarification whether it will hide them completely or merely give them a lower priority or something though.

parent.body:
So how does this work exactly? Are the not-selected categories hidden, or does it just prioritize those categories over others?

The former sounds like making all categories opt-in. Which is... *okay*... it isn't treating categories differently or anything. But having the categories on by default and then letting users opt out of them seems more intuitive. That way they can make a more informed decision.

Wouldn't it be better to instead of asking about "what categories do you want to see" to ask "what categories do you wish to hide"?

I might be just missunderstanding how this will work. Any clarification would be appreciated.

  1. Add the "uncategorized" section to the splash page (maybe rename it to "Other / Miscellaneous"). (I'm not talking about /categories. I'm talking about the splash page.) Otherwise, the visibility of uncategorized guilds is still going to be hindered.
  2. Put a "Skip and show all" button right next to the "Welcome to Ruqqus" / "Select Categories" text for convenience. I know there's already a "show all" button at the bottom of the page, but I dislike it when there's no easy-to-find skip button on these types of pages.
  3. Can this only apply to the "home" page and not the "all" page for logged out users? I'm obsessed with archiving the front page of ruqqus on sites like archive.org and archive.is, and I'm not sure if it can still be done. (If the user hasn't chosen any categories yet, then display all categories on the /all page.)
  4. It looks like when you first sign up, you get redirected to the /browse page. I think that it was mentioned that you didn't want new users seeing the site prompt them to join guilds like +HitlerWasRight (which conveniently happens to be trending). I think they should be redirected to the front page instead.

- sfrohne [ If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username | RIP Klenny | Comment id lt9z ]

post.body:
Having taken all your feedback on board, we've made some fundamental changes to the way categories work. Yesterday, we stopped the disparate treatment of some categories, and made all categories on by default.

To address the concerns of front page appearance, we've put a category selection splash page up for people visiting the Ruqqus home page for the first time. This allows people to pick what they are interested in before having to look at anything.

It looks like this on desktop:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190732810387496/unknown.png)

And like this on mobile:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190986573512704/unknown.png)

This page is also accessible on mobile via the top right dropdown, allowing mobile users to edit their category selections. Yes, this includes selecting the "uncategorized" category.

Thank you everyone for your feedback and the vigorous debate over the best way to preserve freedom.

body:
Carp is already unbanned?

Very disappointing. You'd think with all the kerfuffle about getting things properly categorized so that users aren't driven away by offensive content that the guy who spams gay porn in random guilds and leads targeted harassment campaigns against individuals wouldn't get such special treatment.

He violated the very generous terms of service agreement, then bragged about it, then told everyone that you allow him special privileges that you don't allow other users.  

Those are some bad optics boss.

Honestly I might forgive all the antics if Carp was even a tiny bit funny but he's not. Despite the enormous amount of time he puts into his trolling it's still contemptibly low effort. "I spammed porn at people who don't like porn, aren't I clever?"

parent.body:
Actually, my main concern was about the offensive category. "Do you wish to turn off our offensive filter" seems like pressuring the user, while "Do you wish to turn it on" just seems like an option that no one has to take. Pressuring the user to filter out a category which is vague almost by definition would be... questionable.

But I can't see the offensive category in the selection at all. Does this mean that it has been removed? If so, then I have no issue with this. I trust the admins to apply categories like "politics" or "culture" fairly, since there is no negative connotation, and the users to know exactly what they mean.

I'd still appreciate clarification whether it will hide them completely or merely give them a lower priority or something though.

parent.body:
Suggestions:

1. Add the "uncategorized" section to the splash page (maybe rename it to "Other / Miscellaneous"). (I'm not talking about /categories. I'm talking about the splash page.) Otherwise, the visibility of uncategorized guilds is still going to be hindered.
2. Put a "Skip and show all" button right next to the "Welcome to Ruqqus" / "Select Categories" text for convenience. I know there's already a "show all" button at the bottom of the page, but I dislike it when there's no easy-to-find skip button on these types of pages.
3. Can this only apply to the "home" page and not the "all" page for logged out users? I'm obsessed with archiving the front page of ruqqus on sites like archive.org and archive.is, and I'm not sure if it can still be done. (If the user hasn't chosen any categories yet, then display all categories on the /all page.)
4. It looks like when you first sign up, you get redirected to the /browse page. I think that it was mentioned that you didn't want new users seeing the site prompt them to join guilds like +HitlerWasRight (which conveniently happens to be trending). I think they should be redirected to the front page instead.

<sup> - sfrohne [ If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username | [RIP Klenny](https://ruqq.us/2g1v) | Comment id lt9z ]</sup>

To address the concerns of front page appearance, we've put a category selection splash page up for people visiting the Ruqqus home page for the first time. This allows people to pick what they are interested in before having to look at anything.

It looks like this on desktop:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190732810387496/unknown.png)

And like this on mobile:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190986573512704/unknown.png)

This page is also accessible on mobile via the top right dropdown, allowing mobile users to edit their category selections. Yes, this includes selecting the "uncategorized" category.

Thank you everyone for your feedback and the vigorous debate over the best way to preserve freedom.

parent.body:
Suggestions:

1. Add the "uncategorized" section to the splash page (maybe rename it to "Other / Miscellaneous"). (I'm not talking about /categories. I'm talking about the splash page.) Otherwise, the visibility of uncategorized guilds is still going to be hindered.
2. Put a "Skip and show all" button right next to the "Welcome to Ruqqus" / "Select Categories" text for convenience. I know there's already a "show all" button at the bottom of the page, but I dislike it when there's no easy-to-find skip button on these types of pages.
3. Can this only apply to the "home" page and not the "all" page for logged out users? I'm obsessed with archiving the front page of ruqqus on sites like archive.org and archive.is, and I'm not sure if it can still be done. (If the user hasn't chosen any categories yet, then display all categories on the /all page.)
4. It looks like when you first sign up, you get redirected to the /browse page. I think that it was mentioned that you didn't want new users seeing the site prompt them to join guilds like +HitlerWasRight (which conveniently happens to be trending). I think they should be redirected to the front page instead.

<sup> - sfrohne [ If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username | [RIP Klenny](https://ruqq.us/2g1v) | Comment id lt9z ]</sup>

post.body:
Having taken all your feedback on board, we've made some fundamental changes to the way categories work. Yesterday, we stopped the disparate treatment of some categories, and made all categories on by default.

To address the concerns of front page appearance, we've put a category selection splash page up for people visiting the Ruqqus home page for the first time. This allows people to pick what they are interested in before having to look at anything.

It looks like this on desktop:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190732810387496/unknown.png)

And like this on mobile:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190986573512704/unknown.png)

This page is also accessible on mobile via the top right dropdown, allowing mobile users to edit their category selections. Yes, this includes selecting the "uncategorized" category.

Thank you everyone for your feedback and the vigorous debate over the best way to preserve freedom.

parent.body:
So how does this work exactly? Are the not-selected categories hidden, or does it just prioritize those categories over others?

The former sounds like making all categories opt-in. Which is... *okay*... it isn't treating categories differently or anything. But having the categories on by default and then letting users opt out of them seems more intuitive. That way they can make a more informed decision.

Wouldn't it be better to instead of asking about "what categories do you want to see" to ask "what categories do you wish to hide"?

I might be just missunderstanding how this will work. Any clarification would be appreciated.

Carp is already unbanned?

Very disappointing. You'd think with all the kerfuffle about getting things properly categorized so that users aren't driven away by offensive content that the guy who spams gay porn in random guilds and leads targeted harassment campaigns against individuals wouldn't get such special treatment.

He violated the very generous terms of service agreement, then bragged about it, then told everyone that you allow him special privileges that you don't allow other users.  

Those are some bad optics boss.

Honestly I might forgive all the antics if Carp was even a tiny bit funny but he's not. Despite the enormous amount of time he puts into his trolling it's still contemptibly low effort. "I spammed porn at people who don't like porn, aren't I clever?"

Looks great! I think this is a good compromise between the folks who want everything visible and those who want a more...*appealing* front page. Now new folks will be able to choose what they want to see. 

I still think that the best option would've been to have an "All" feed *and* another feed that filters out the crap most folks don't want to see. Hopefully that's still on the table.

To address the concerns of front page appearance, we've put a category selection splash page up for people visiting the Ruqqus home page for the first time. This allows people to pick what they are interested in before having to look at anything.

It looks like this on desktop:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190732810387496/unknown.png)

And like this on mobile:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190986573512704/unknown.png)

This page is also accessible on mobile via the top right dropdown, allowing mobile users to edit their category selections. Yes, this includes selecting the "uncategorized" category.

Thank you everyone for your feedback and the vigorous debate over the best way to preserve freedom.

body: New visitors coming to Ruqqus for the first time are shown this screen. Each box corresponds to a top-level category. For each category selected, all sub-categories are turned on and the user is sent to the home page.
body_html: New visitors coming to Ruqqus for the first time are shown this screen. Each box corresponds to a top-level category. For each category selected, all sub-categories are turned on and the user is sent to the home page.

parent.body:
So how does this work exactly? Are the not-selected categories hidden, or does it just prioritize those categories over others?

The former sounds like making all categories opt-in. Which is... *okay*... it isn't treating categories differently or anything. But having the categories on by default and then letting users opt out of them seems more intuitive. That way they can make a more informed decision.

Wouldn't it be better to instead of asking about "what categories do you want to see" to ask "what categories do you wish to hide"?

I might be just missunderstanding how this will work. Any clarification would be appreciated.

body:
Thoughts: The animated gifs makes it look crowded and gives me a headache. I don't know how many people this will bother, but if they take this page as a "standard" for what they'll see design wise for Ruqqus, I think that might scare some people off.

Additionally, I think it might be wise to have some visual signifier that a category is enabled or disabled aside from a purple or gray filter. A checkmark/x in the corner could suffice. Of course, if a user does happen to get it reversed, I imagine they'll probably figure it out pretty quickly, and fix it once they see the category selection in all or hot (which DOES use checkmarks).
body_html:

Having taken all your feedback on board, we've made some fundamental changes to the way categories work. Yesterday, we stopped the disparate treatment of some categories, and made all categories on by default.

To address the concerns of front page appearance, we've put a category selection splash page up for people visiting the Ruqqus home page for the first time. This allows people to pick what they are interested in before having to look at anything.

It looks like this on desktop:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190732810387496/unknown.png)

And like this on mobile:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/794190986573512704/unknown.png)

This page is also accessible on mobile via the top right dropdown, allowing mobile users to edit their category selections. Yes, this includes selecting the "uncategorized" category.

Thank you everyone for your feedback and the vigorous debate over the best way to preserve freedom.

body: I love this system. It allows me to introduce people to ruqqus who just want to do hobby guilds, memes, or other non political things.
